name: FirstIntroTalk
_source: s;Morrissey;We're here.{w} Simon, are you unharmed?
s;Simon;I... yes?{w} I don't understand what you mean.
s;Morrissey;The outer city in Troy has a certain reputation.|We are in the interior, now, however.|You and your men should be perfectly safe here.
s;Simon;I wasn't aware the capital was in such a state.|I thought the military kept order here?
s;Morrissey;They are well-trained in crushing dissent.{w} No armed rebellion has have approached Troy.

s;Morrissey;They are no peacekeepers.{w} So long as the criminals don't challenge the crown,|they're left alone.|The civilian watchmen here are known to be corrupt,|and the military protects only here, the inner city.
s;Simon;Lord Morrissey, the more I see of Trojan land...|Is it really possible for them to aid us?

s;Morrissey;Perhaps, perhaps not.{w} Either way, we ought to take stock of their strength.|Take heed of what I said at the garrison:|If we are not careful, they may become as much of a threat as any rebel.
s;Morrissey;Good.{w} I'll await you by the castle doors.|Join me whenever you're ready.
